column4: Ok, I accidentally disconnected my Windows Server box from the internet.  I can boot into a Linux "RESCUE SYSTEM" and access the Windows server...is there any way I can fix it?
does your server have a remote kvm?
if you have a remote kvm then you should be able to sort the nic out not sure from a live cd
I'm looking for it now on my host's website.  I might just have to copy my data on my hard drives to my website and format the box.  How can I navigate to my hard drive in the terminal?
whos your host?
Hetnzer.de
if its a dedi they should have a remote kvm an eric drac or similiar
ouch
are they managed servers or un managed?
for a one off the engineer service would be cheaper that setup fe is ridiculus
I agree
can you run an ipconfig /renew from the live cd
what do you mean? in the Windows command line? I can't get into that, I believe I'm in a Debian-based rescue system
yeah can you execute or run anything windows side?
Don't believe so...at this point, I think I should just format. I just need my stuff off of there now
you got backups?
Nope, I activated my freaking backup account, but the login wouldn't work
Id contact your host see what they offer were I used to work we offered unmanaged boxes but in certain circumstances we would fix for free
Thanks, will do
although we also included remote kvm with our servers
sftp
Thanks :)
that should work I usually use root for sftp though and ubuntu doesent have default root unless you set it
